application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Details required for condition 4 (Materials) and 5 (Historic Environment Record) of planning permission 20/02383/LBC. Careful recording of existing masonry, submission of samples and templates for approval, careful dismantling of stone copings and balusters, storage and protection of components for re-use.  Careful removal of decayed stone components or cutting back of decayed stone to a firm substrate.  Installation of new indented stone repairs and replacement of decayed stone components in new stone to match the existing, bedded and pointed in lime mortar to approved samples.  Pinning of fractured stone with resin bonded threaded stainless steel dowels.  Removal of loose/failed mortar generally and repointing with new lime mortar to approved samples.
decision_conditions: Please note the archaeological Condition (Condition 5) will not be fully satisfied until all works are complete, including any post-excavation assessment/analysis leading to publication.Reason - For the avoidance of doubt.
